column4: what is the difference between alternate install cd and the regular? I notice a few differences from some google searches (text based installer, various LVM options, grub options etc) can anyone explain more about this
I am just starting with Ubuntu but I have used *nix for about 6 years, is there that big of a difference between the alternate and gui installer?
not too much. but the latest installer is cool.. its boots into live demo and optionally installs while you chekout the system.. darn cool me thinks..
i'm talkin bout ubuntu.. don't know about kubuntu and the alternatives
